name: aws-lambda
hubDesc: Invoke and manage AWS Lambda functions from Kong
description: Invoke an AWS Lambda function from Kong. It can be used in combination with other request plugins to secure, manage, or extend the function.

fields.name: aws_key
fields.help: The AWS key credential to be used when invoking the function. This value is required if aws_secret is defined.

fields.name: aws_secret
fields.help: The AWS secret credential to be used when invoking the function. This value is required if aws_key is defined.

fields.name: aws region
fields.help: The AWS region where the Lambda function is located. Regions supported are: ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ap-south-1, ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, ca-central-1, cn-north-1, cn-northwest-1, eu-central-1, eu-west-1, eu-west-2, sa-east-1, us-east-1, us-east-2, us-gov-west-1, us-west-1, us-west-2.

fields.name: function_name
fields.help: The AWS Lambda function name to invoke

fields.name: qualifier
fields.help: The Qualifier to use when invoking the function.

fields.name: invocation_type
fields.help: The InvocationType to use when invoking the function. Available types are RequestResponse, Event, DryRun

fields.name: log_type
fields.help: The LogType to use when invoking the function. By default None and Tail are supported

fields.name: timeout
fields.help: An optional timeout in milliseconds when invoking the function

fields.name: port
fields.help: The TCP port that this plugin will use to connect to the server.

fields.name: keepalive
fields.help: An optional value in milliseconds that defines how long an idle connection will live before being closed

fields.name: unhandled_status
fields.help: The response status code to use (instead of the default 200, 202, or 204) in the case of an Unhandled Function Error

fields.name: forward_request_body
fields.help: An optional value that defines whether the request body is to be sent in the request_body field of the JSON-encoded request. If the body arguments can be parsed, they will be sent in the separate request_body_args field of the request. The body arguments can be parsed for application/json, application/x-www-form-urlencoded, and multipart/form-data content types.

fields.name: forward_request_headers
fields.help: An optional value that defines whether the original HTTP request headers are to be sent as a map in the request_headers field of the JSON-encoded request.

fields.name: forward_request_method
fields.help: An optional value that defines whether the original HTTP request method verb is to be sent in the request_method field of the JSON-encoded request.

fields.name: forward_request_uri
fields.help: An optional value that defines whether the original HTTP request URI is to be sent in the request_uri field of the JSON-encoded request. Request URI arguments (if any) will be sent in the separate request_uri_args field of the JSON body.

fields.name: is_proxy_integration
fields.help: An optional value that defines whether the response format to receive from the Lambda to this format. Note that the parameter isBase64Encoded is not implemented.
